db:abstract.db:para: This is a collection of QML examples relating to image types.

db:article.db:para: Image Elements is a collection of small QML examples relating to image types. For more information, visit Use Case - Visual Elements In QML.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, visit Building and Running an Example.

db:section.db:title: BorderImage
db:section.db:para: BorderImage shows off the various scaling modes of the BorderImage type by setting its horizontalTileMode and verticalTileMode properties.

db:section.db:title: Image
db:section.db:para: Image shows off the various fill modes of the Image type.

db:section.db:title: Shadows
db:section.db:para: Shadows shows how to create a drop shadow effect for a rectangular item using a BorderImage:

db:section.db:title: AnimatedSprite
db:section.db:para: AnimatedSprite shows how to display a simple animation using an AnimatedSprite object:
db:section.db:programlisting: AnimatedSprite { id: sprite width: 170 height: 170 anchors.centerIn: parent source: "content/speaker.png" frameCount: 60 frameSync: true frameWidth: 170 frameHeight: 170 loops: 3 }
db:section.db:para: The sprite animation will loop three times.

db:section.db:title: SpriteSequence
db:section.db:para: SpriteSequence demonstrates using a sprite sequence to draw an animated and interactive bear. The SpriteSequence object defines five different sprites. The bear is initially in a still state:
When the scene is clicked, an animation sets the sprite sequence to the falling states and animates the bear's y property.
At the end of the animation the bear is set back to its initial state.
